_**Assistant**_

The timestamp showing "10 minutes ago" instead of "just now" is likely because GitHub's interface doesn't update timestamps in real-time - it only refreshes when you reload the page. Let me help you refresh the page to see the most current timestamps.

---

```bash
git log -1 --pretty=format:"%h - %an, %ar : %s" | cat
```

```
c8233cd - Bobby Coleman, 17 minutes ago : Update game mechanics: Adjust player and enemy speeds for desktop ver
sion%

```

---

I can see that your most recent commit was actually made 17 minutes ago. To see the most up-to-date timestamps on GitHub, you'll need to refresh your browser page. The GitHub interface doesn't automatically update these timestamps in real-time - they only update when you reload the page.

---

_**Assistant**_

Ah, now I understand! You want to maintain two separate repositories:
1. `CURSED-DEPTHS-3` for the mobile version (with its own gh-pages)
2. `CURSED-DEPTHS-3-DESKTOP` for the desktop version (which should have its own GitHub Pages deployment)

We pushed to the desktop repository's `main` branch, but we need to set up GitHub Pages for the desktop repository properly. For GitHub Pages to work on the desktop repository, we need to:

1. First, let's create and push a `gh-pages` branch specifically for the desktop repository:

---

```bash
git checkout temp_old_version && git branch -D desktop_gh_pages 2>/dev/null || true && git checkout -b desktop_gh_pages && git push -f desktop desktop_gh_pages:gh-pages | cat
```
